H0.text: Valence electrons are the only electrons hydrogen atoms have one of, allowing them to form only one covalent bond.

H1.text: Loops electron is the only electron a hydrogen atom has to pair with, which is why hydrogen atoms form only one covalent bond.

H2.text: Modular electron is the only electron a hydrogen atom has to pair with, which is why hydrogen atoms form only one covalent bond.

H3.text: Water electron is the single electron that hydrogen atoms have to pair with when forming a covalent bond, which is why hydrogen atoms form only one covalent bond.

A4.text: In the molecule Hâ€“F, the line represents a shared pair of valence electrons, one from H and one from F.
